title.native: 田中くんはいつもけだるげ

description:
For high school student Tanaka, the act of being listless is a way of life. Known for his inattentiveness and ability to fall asleep anywhere, Tanaka prays that each day will be as uneventful as the last, seeking to preserve his lazy lifestyle however he can by avoiding situations that require him to exert himself. Along with his dependable friend Oota who helps him with tasks he is unable to accomplish, the lethargic teenager constantly deals with events that prevent him from experiencing the quiet and peaceful days he longs for.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

node.description:
__[Website](https://coorie.futureartist.net/) | [Profile (Peak A Soul)](https://www.peakasoul.net/coorie) | [Blog (JP)](https://rinocoorie.exblog.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rino_CooRie)__

__Formed:__ 2002 (as a two-piece unit), 2003 (as a solo unit)
__Disbanded:__ 2003 (as a two-piece unit)

__Biography:__
CooRie was a Japanese self-produced two-piece music unit under record labels Mellow Head and Lantis consisting of the members Rino and Naoyuki Osada, where Rino would perform the vocals and do the lyrics, while Osada would do the composition and arrangement. About a year after they formed, Osada would formally leave the unit in 2003, which is also when they disbanded as a two-piece unit. 

Rino decided to reform the music unit as a solo unit after Osada's departure, and has since been the sole member, who now performs the vocals, while also doing most of the lyrics and composition in the songs. When it comes to the arrangement, the unit largely collaborates with other creators, most prominently [Kaoru Ookubo](https://anilist.co/staff/150930/Kaoru-Ookubo), who has made the arrangement for 19 of CooRie's songs between 2005 and 2015.

__Members:__
- [Rino](https://anilist.co/staff/96532) (りの) – vocalist and in-charge of lyrics and composition

__Former Members:__
- Naoyuki Osada (長田直之) – keyboardist and in-charge of composition and arrangement

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.

Kozue Kananiwa graduated from the HOSEI University of Tokyo, Faculty of Letters, Department of Japan Literature. Her first work as a producer was for [Oh! My Goddess](https://anilist.co/anime/50/Aa-Megamisama-TV/) in 2005.

Since, she participated in the production many renown series such as [Mahou Shoujo Madoka☆Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Mahou-Shoujo-MadokaMagica/) in 2011, [Steins;Gate](https://anilist.co/anime/9253/SteinsGate) the same year, or more recently [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/Horimiya/).

Now, she is the General Manager of  both U-NEXT Anime & Book Division and of the Production Department.

(Source : Bangumi 番組計画RC3)

__Hayato Kaneko__ is a Japanese producer, animation planner and representative director of Studio Silver Link. He was a former employee at Studio Frontline (which went bankrupt in 2011), where he established his own team, recruiting staffers while still being under Frontline, and turning independent as an own studio going with the name Studio Silver Link later on.

The Studio 'Silver Link' had it's first appearance as a subcontracting animation studio with the production of TV series [Tayutama](https://anilist.co/anime/5734/Tayutama-Kiss-on-My-Deity/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).

__Hayato Kaneko__ is a Japanese producer, animation planner and representative director of Studio Silver Link. He was a former employee at Studio Frontline (which went bankrupt in 2011), where he established his own team, recruiting staffers while still being under Frontline, and turning independent as an own studio going with the name Studio Silver Link later on.

The Studio 'Silver Link' had it's first appearance as a subcontracting animation studio with the production of TV series [Tayutama](https://anilist.co/anime/5734/Tayutama-Kiss-on-My-Deity/).
_Note: Not to be confused with either the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/157702/), or the [editor](https://anilist.co/staff/181541/) by the same name._

**Residency:** Nerima, Tokyo, Japan
**Graduated:** Meiji University

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tr.netamemo)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/netamemo)**

**Yoshie Terushige** is a Japanese producer who works for the company Lantis.
